cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi SSE of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Creeping north-north-eastward toward the Mississippi/Alabama Gulf Coast, then inland across Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi-Alabama state line (Gulfport–Biloxi area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch west of the Pearl River mouth and Tropical Storm Watch areas are confined to the north-central Gulf Coast – none for the central-west Florida coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning east of the Pearl River mouth to Navarre, FL; Tropical Storm Warning east of Navarre to Indian Pass, FL – well northwest of Port Manatee.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle; inland Alabama and Georgia later in the week.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional outer-band gusts 20–30 mph possible Wednesday–Thursday; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Tampa Bay; guidance shows at most 1–2 ft further north toward Florida Big Bend.
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent squalls could drop 1–3 inches of rain, locally 4 inches, but widespread 4-inch totals are not expected at Port Manatee.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf along west-central Florida beaches during mid-week.
